nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils

Class BigDecimalHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.BigDecimalHelper

  • public class BigDecimalHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for handling BigDecimals Contains several useful BigDecimal mathematical functions taken from: "Java Number Cruncher, the java programmer's guide to numerical computing" by Ronald Mak, Prentice Hall PTR, 2003. pages 330 & 331
    Author:
    luis, Rinke, Ronald Mak

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • arctan

        public static java.math.BigDecimal arctan(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                          int scale)
        Compute the arctangent of x to a given scale, |x| < 1
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        scale - the desired scale of the result
        Returns:
        the result value

      • asPercentageOf

        public static java.math.BigDecimal asPercentageOf(java.math.BigDecimal amount,
                                  java.math.BigDecimal total)
        returns amount as a percentage of total. Example: if amount is 5 and total is 50, then BigDecimalHelper.asPercentageOf(amount, total) equals 10 (%).
        Parameters:
        amount - the BigDecimal to be written as a percentage.
        total - the BigDecimal representing the total amount of which amount is a percentage.
        Returns:
        amount as a BigDecimal percentage of total.

      • asPercentFraction

        public static java.math.BigDecimal asPercentFraction(java.math.BigDecimal bigDecimal)
        returns a nominal percentage (like 5.2%) as a fraction (0.052).
        Returns:
        the BigDecimal divided by 100. In the above example this would be 0.052.

      • exp

        public static java.math.BigDecimal exp(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                       int scale)
        Compute e^x to a given scale. Break x into its whole and fraction parts and compute (e^(1 + fraction/whole))^whole using Taylor's formula.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        scale - the desired scale of the result
        Returns:
        the result value

      • intPower

        public static java.math.BigDecimal intPower(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                            long exponent,
                            int scale)
        Compute x^exponent to a given scale.
        Parameters:
        x - the value x
        exponent - the exponent value
        scale - the desired scale of the result
        Returns:
        the result value

      • intRoot

        public static java.math.BigDecimal intRoot(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                           long index,
                           int scale)
        Compute the integral root of x to a given scale, x >= 0. Use Newton's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        index - the integral root value
        scale - the desired scale of the result
        Returns:
        the result value

      • ln

        public static java.math.BigDecimal ln(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                      int scale)
        Compute the natural logarithm of x to a given scale, x > 0.

      • nvl

        public static java.math.BigDecimal nvl(java.math.BigDecimal bigDecimal)
        Returns zero when the given BigDecimal is null

      • pow

        public static java.math.BigDecimal pow(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                       int scale,
                       java.math.BigDecimal exponent)
        calculates x^exponent, that is, raise x to the poser of exponent. (by Rinke)
        Parameters:
        x - the BigDecimal to be "powered".
        scale - the desired scale of the result
        exponent - the double which will be used to raise x to its power.
        Returns:
        the result value

      • simpleLn

        @Deprecated
public static java.math.BigDecimal simpleLn(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                                       int scale)
        Deprecated. 
        extremely simple version natural logarithm, using no algorith tricks, but just via doubles and recreating BigDecimal Might give less accurate results, but this is to be tested. As long as this hasn't happened it is deprecated.

      • sqrt

        public static java.math.BigDecimal sqrt(java.math.BigDecimal x,
                        int scale)
        Compute the square root of x to a given scale, x >= 0. Use Newton's algorithm.
        Parameters:
        x - the value of x
        scale - the desired scale of the result
        Returns:
        the result value
